# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly as pyo
import plotly.express as px

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.2d3ead2f:

years = year_group.index.tolist()
year_count = year_group.tolist()

year_df = pd.DataFrame({'year':years, 'population':year_count})

source.e5f0a324:
values = data_2020.head(5)['World Share %'].tolist()
values.append(100 - sum(values))
names = data_2020.head(5)['Country (or dependency)'].tolist()
names.append('Other')

fig = px.pie(values=values, names=names, title='World population share')
fig.show()
source.3d813704:
above65 = pd.read_csv('../input/world-population-19602018/population_above_age_65_percentage_long.csv')
group_age = above65.groupby('Year').Count.mean()

years = group_age.index.tolist()
pcts = group_age.tolist()
source.aea13c76:
fig = px.line(x=years, y=pcts, labels={'x':'Years', 'y':'Percentage'}, title='People above 65 percentage worldwide')
fig.show()

source.4882a1d7:
density = pd.read_csv('../input/world-population-19602018/population_density_long.csv')
group_year = density.groupby('Year').Count.mean()

years = group_year.index.tolist()
pcts = group_year.tolist()
source.eeaa338d:
fig = px.line(x=years, y=pcts, labels={'x':'Years', 'y':'Density'}, title='World Density')
fig.show()
